articles.author: Frank Heinz
articles.title: At Least 9 Homes Destroyed in Balch Springs Grass Fire, Possibly Another Dozen Damaged
articles.description: A large grass fire in Balch Springs, Texas has caught multiple homes on fire Monday afternoon, causing evacuations in the area.
articles.content:
• Fire has destroyed nine homes and possibly damaged another dozen.
  • No injuries have been reported to either residents or firefighters.
  • Fire is believed to have started after mo… [+2023 chars]

articles.title: Pence's former chief of staff Marc Short appears before January 6 grand jury
articles.description: Marc Short, the former chief of staff to Vice President Mike Pence, confirmed Monday that he testified last week in front of a grand jury investigating the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol in Washington, DC.

articles.title: Judge blocks enforcement of N.C. law that demands truth in campaign ads
articles.description: The state's attorney general was in danger of being prosecuted for airing a possibly untruthful ad in 2020.
articles.content: The law prohibits anyone from knowingly publishing or circulating false information about a candidate with the intent of hurting that candidates chances in the election. It enabled an ongoing investi… [+3514 chars]

articles.title: U.S. Officials Grow More Concerned About Potential Action by China on Taiwan
articles.description: The Biden administration is watching for any moves by China to close off the Taiwan Strait, and they would prefer that Nancy Pelosi cancel her planned trip.
articles.content: U.S. military officials say a sea-and-air invasion of Taiwan would be difficult for the Peoples Liberation Army to pull off today. If China did move earlier than expected against Taiwan, it could do … [+1311 chars]

articles.title: Explosive wildfire near Yosemite grows, forcing thousands of evacuations: "It's absolutely terrifying"
articles.description: More than 2,000 firefighters backed by 17 helicopters have been deployed against the Oak Fire, which broke out near Yosemite National Park.
articles.content: A fierce California wildfire expanded Monday, burning several thousand acres and forcing evacuations as tens of millions of Americans sweltered through scorching heat over the weekend. More than 2,00… [+4570 chars]

articles.title: Sixth boy charged in Central Park jogger case is exonerated
articles.description: A long overlooked co-defendant of the Central Park Five, a group of Black and Latino teenagers wrongly convicted of raping a white woman jogger in 1989 based on false confessions, was exonerated of a related conviction by a New York judge on Monday.
articles.content: NEW YORK, July 25 (Reuters) - A long overlooked co-defendant of the Central Park Five, a group of Black and Latino teenagers wrongly convicted of raping a white woman jogger in 1989 based on false co… [+3383 chars]

articles.title: Raising Cane's founder buys 50,000 Mega Millions lottery tickets
articles.description: If any of the 50,000 tickets is the lucky number, each of Raising Cane’s employees would win thousands.

BATON ROUGE, La. Raising Cane's is hoping to win a jackpot for its workers.
Raising Canes founder Todd Graves announced Monday he has purchased 50,000 Mega Millions lottery tickets.
